Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can draw two people with a simple connection between them, such as a line representing a string (basic concept of connection).
The student can attempt to show a string linking two paper cups or similar objects, attempting to illustrate the basic setup of a string telephone.
The student can show some attempt at a design indicating that the device might help in communication over a distance (e.g., two people standing far apart).
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to clearly show how sound travels through the string due to a lack of understanding of sound waves *(student might only draw a straight line without further detail)*.
The student may not depict specific design features accurately, such as tension in the string or cups facing the right directions *(cups might face incorrectly without showing sound reception)*.

The student is likely to misunderstand how the string telephone meets the needs of distant communication; they may not illustrate this benefit clearly *(distant communication not effectively represented)*.
